intro: Guettardella livida, commonly known as the velvetleaf or green velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Guettardella livida is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain areas.
